result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler James Zoromski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Tyler James Zoromski
Current: 267 White Oak Avenue, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 04-21-2017)
Prior: 267 White Oak, Phlox, WI 54464 United States

Defendant Tyler James Zoromski in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 16CM499, 15CT170, 16CM131, 15CM477, 15CT214, 15CM411, 16CM132.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT170 Count 1 OWI 2nd: No Contest
15CT170 Count 3 OAR: No Contest
16CM499 Count 1 OWI 3rd: No Contest
16CM499 Count 3 OAR: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CT170 Cts 1 & 2 and 16CM499 Cts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CT170 Ct 2 and 16CM499 Ct 2 are Dismissed. 15CT170 Ct 4, 16CM499 Ct 4, 5, 6, & 7, 16CM131, 15CM477, 15CT214, 15CM411, and 16CM132 are Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing recommendations to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs in part with joint recommendation and request less days jail and concurrent.

BY THE COURT:**
15CT170 Count 1 OWI 2nd .179%:
37 days jail, report today to start immediately. Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. First half in jail and other 1/2 on electronic monitor, if eligible according to local jail rules. 
$1,618.00 includes fine/costs/surcharges
$26.45 Pay for Blood Draw Costs.
16 months Revocation of Driver's license
16 months IID
DOT/AODA Safety Plan
Provide DNA sample if not already done so.

15CT170 Count 3 OAR:
10 days jail, concurrent with Count 1
Pay costs and surcharges

16CM499 Count 1 OWI 3rd .136%:
75 days jail, consecutive to 15CT170, Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.  First half in jail and other 1/2 on electronic monitor, if eligible according to local jail rules. 5 days credit.
$2,067.00 includes fine/costs/surcharges
$26.45 Pay for Blood Draw Costs.
28 months Revocation of Driver's License, concurrent with 15CT170 revocation
28 months IID, concurrent with 15CT170 IID
DOT/AODA Safety Plan

16CM499 Count 3 OAR: 
10 days jail, concurrent with Count 1
Pay costs and surcharges

Bonds in any of the files heard today to be applied to fine/costs/surcharges. Balance to pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.
Defendant is remainded to the Portage County Sheriff's Dept.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler James Zoromski
Current: 2443 Clearbrook Circle, Green Bay, WI 54313 United States  (Effective: 11-07-2016)
Prior: 267 White Oak Avenue, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant Tyler James Zoromski in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard for Initial Appearances:  16CM131, 16CM132, 16CM499
All files heard for Return on Warrants: 15CT170, 15CT214, 15CM411, 15CM477, 16CM131, 16CM132

BY THE COURT:  Warrants are quashed on all files. 

16CM131, 16CM132, 16CM499:  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaints.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaints.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

State recommends the following for bonds: 
16CM131 - $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.  
16CM132 - Additional $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
16CM499 - Additional $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Atty Halverson makes bond arguments to the Court.  Requests signature bonds on all files.  

BY THE COURT: 
$1,000 cash bond covering all three files 16CM131, 16CM132 and 16CM499:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On all court dates.
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff's department.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.
